{"step_by_step_thinking": "After resection of the posterior pituitary, the hormones that are typically affected are the ones that are produced and released by the posterior pituitary gland. The posterior pituitary gland primarily releases two hormones: oxytocin and antidiuretic hormone (ADH), also known as vasopressin. Therefore, the hormone that is not given after resection of the posterior pituitary would be the one that is not normally produced and released by the posterior pituitary gland.", "answer_choice": "A. Glucagon"}
